newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Networkers, Intel weaker.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Networkers, Intel weaker.

text.p: Shares in Ascend Communications Inc and its merger partner Cascade Communications Corp weakened in U.S. pre-open trade Friday, extending a sell-off that began last night.
In early third-market trade, Ascend fell to 42-3/4 from 46-3/8 while Cascade tumbled to 28 from 30-3/8.

After the market close Thursday, Ascend said it earned $0.27 per share after a charge in the first quarter versus $0.15 last year. Before the charge, Ascend earned $0.36 per share, above the $0.33 First Call analysts' consensus view.

Cascade reported a loss of $2.13 per share after a charge, a loss of $0.15 before the charge, versus a profit of $0.11 one year ago, and said first quarter revenues of $90.3 million were below analyst expectations and the prior quarter.
"For Ascend and Cascade that is not good and Cascade is going where Ascend goes because of the merger," a trader said.
Ascend announced its stock-swap acqusition of Cascade on March 30, a deal that was then valued at $3.7 billion.
Among other computer networking stocks, Cisco Systems Inc fell to 51-1/8 from 52-5/8 and Tellabs Inc slipped to 36-5/8 from 37-7/8.
Elsewhere, Intel Corp fell two points to 135-1/4.
The world's largest maker of computer chips said it will cut the price of its Pentium products by the end of the month.
Other stocks active ahead of the open included Microsoft off one point to 95-3/4, Oracle down to 36-5/8 from 37-1/2 and Sun Microsystems losing 1/2 to 28-1/2.
